thread.title: Lady Roadrunners Tie For Golf Championship
thread.title_full: Lady Roadrunners Tie For Golf Championship

title: Lady Roadrunners Tie For Golf Championship
text: Tuesday, October 13 2015, 10:00 PM EDT Lady Roadrunners Tie For Golf Championship Valdosta, GA. – TheNo. 5 Dalton State women’s golf team (296-317 = 613) finished the two-day,36-hole Thomas University Invitational in a tie for first place with SCADSavannah (303-310 = 613), who came from seven-strokes down on Tuesday at the5943 yards, Par 72 Kinderlou Forest Golf Club. “We did nothave our best day, but it was still good enough in a field of five top tenteams to come out on top,” said DS Coach Jim McGrew. “I’m disappointed that welet some shots get away that we should not have. That happened because we letour emotions get the best of us. We’ll use this as a learning experience as wegrow.” Coastal Georgia (71-75 = 146) finished the tournament as low medalist. DaltonState’s Katie Dalton (72-77 = 149) was three strokes back. SCAD Savannah’sCorinna Grans-Wood (75-76 = 151) finished third and Mariona Maeso (76-76 = 152)was fourth. Erika Wardzinski (74-79 = 153) finished tied for fifth. JuliaMcQuilken (74-81 = 155) finished tied at 11 th . Caroline Griffin(76-83 = 159) and Rachel Rebne (79-80 = 159) were tied for 18 th inthe 57 player field. University of the Cumberlands – KY. (304-317 = 621) was third, Coastal Georgia(308-316 = 624) finished fourth, The University of South Carolina at Beaufort (312-316= 628) finished 5 th , and Thomas University (305-325 = 630) was 6 th .Four Florida schools rounded out the ten team tournament. SoutheasternUniversity (322-347 = 669), Webber International (348-341 = 689), Ave Maria(374-373 – 747) and Warner University (406-368 = 774). The LadyRoadrunners will finish-up the fall schedule in the Chick-Fil-A Classic,sponsored by Berry College, at Coosa Country Club in Rome on October26-27. “We are excited to be undefeatedfor the season and look forward to that final tournament of the fall,” addedMcGrew.
